setting.conf_title: Show link in header to guidelines?
External http:// link to guidlines page?
setting.conf_description: Enter the URL to a set of external guidelines or if you wish to add your guidelines below simply leave this box clear.

setting.conf_title: If not using external link; guidelines/rules text
setting.conf_description: HTML Enabled
The content of this section will be displayed before a member can register a new account. HTML ENABLED
setting.conf_default: Forum Terms & Rules Please take a moment to review these rules detailed below. If you agree with them and wish to proceed with the registration, simply click the "Register" button below. To cancel this registration, simply hit the 'back' button on your browser. Please remember that we are not responsible for any messages posted. We do not vouch for or warrant the accuracy, completeness or usefulness of any message, and are not responsible for the contents of any message. The messages express the views of the author of the message, not necessarily the views of this bulletin board. Any user who feels that a posted message is objectionable is encouraged to contact us immediately by email. We have the ability to remove objectionable messages and we will make every effort to do so, within a reasonable time frame, if we determine that removal is necessary. You agree, through your use of this service, that you will not use this bulletin board to post any material which is knowingly false and/or defamatory, inaccurate, abusive, vulgar, hateful, harassing, obscene, profane, sexually oriented, threatening, invasive of a person's privacy, or otherwise violative of any law. You agree not to post any copyrighted material unless the copyright is owned by you or by this bulletin board.

setting.conf_description: The board will still be accessable by those who have permission (settable from the Users & Groups section).

setting.conf_title: Show birthdays on the main calendar view?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", the calendar will show the number of birthdays for that day.

setting.conf_title: Show Today's birthdays on the board view?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will show the day's birthdays on the board index view.

setting.conf_title: Auto hide when no birthdays to show?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will remove the "Today's Birthdays" block from the board index when there is none to show.
If set to "yes", this will show single forthcoming calendar events on the board index view. It will not show recurring events or ranged events.

setting.conf_title: Auto hide when no events to show?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will remove the forcoming calendar events block from the board index view if there are none to show.

setting.conf_title: Show forthcoming events from today to [x] days ahead
setting.conf_description: Controls how far into the future events are shown on the forcoming events block on board index view.

setting.conf_title: Starting year for calendar 'Year' drop down box
setting.conf_description: This applies to view calendar / post event.

setting.conf_title: Year end limit for 'Year' drop down box
setting.conf_description:
This applies to view calendar / post event.
Example: current year is 2002, you enter 5 - last choosable year = 2007

setting.conf_title: Log in with user name or email address?
setting.conf_description: Which identifiable piece of information do you wish to require your members to use when logging in?
Hint: use .your-domain.com for global cookie
Allows multiple boards on one host.
Relative path from domain to root IBF dir
Enabling COPPA on your board will require children under the age of 13 to get parental consent via a faxed or mailed form.

setting.conf_title: Fax number to receive COPPA forms
Mail address to receive COPPA forms
Allow custom profile field info be used in TopicView?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will add a LEFT JOIN onto the custom profile field table.
Not recommended if your board isn't visited daily.

setting.conf_title: Cut off for active user display [in minutes]
Storing Read Topics in the Database
setting.conf_description: Enter how many days you wish to store read topic information for. For large busy boards we recommend keeping it to around 7 days to prevent a large slow database table. The task manager will prune back this table to keep it manageable. Enter 0 (zero) to NOT store read topic info in the database.

setting.conf_title: Mark topics a user has posted when displaying a forum?

setting.conf_description: This save 1 query per forum view
(This save 1 query per topic view)

setting.conf_title: Allow users (where allowed) to use search?

setting.conf_description: Show the board totals at the footer of the board index page.

Will display 'busy' message when limit hit
Can be left blank for no limit
Allowing shorter search words can return more results, such as 'if', 'at', etc. Note, this will not have any effect if you are full text search.
(This will stop browsers caching pages)

Refers to when returning search results as posts
Leave blank to return full post with proper formatting
This will remove sub-forums from the drop down list - useful if you have many

If you have chosen the correct timezone and the clock is an hour out, this is because of daylight savings time and your members can correct this by editing their 'Board settings' via their User Control Panel.

You fine tune the server time. If you need to subtract minutes from the server time, start the number with a '-' (no quotes)
Board time (inc. above time zone and current adj.) is now: <-T->
Same configuration as PHP Date
Same configuration as <a href='http://www.php.net/date' target='_blank'>PHP Date
Same configuration as PHP Date
Would use 'today' and 'yesterday' in posts / last post info
{--} Will be replaced with 'today' or 'yesterday'
This is the email address that all incoming mail is addressed to.
This is the email address that all mail appears to come from.
If PHP's mail() isn't available, choose SMTP. If you are unsure, please ask your web host.
Default is 'localhost'
Default is 25
Some SMTP mailers require that email addresses are in the following format '<' address '>' (no quotes). If you are getting errors in the mail error log, enabled this option
Not required in most cases when using 'localhost'
Not required in most cases when using 'localhost'
Choose between "full text" searching or "manual" searching.
This setting will only take effect if using full text searching
This is the name of the board. It is used as the first link in the navigation menu, etc.
This is the name of your website. If this and "Website Address' is filled in, your website address and name will appear on the board above the header by default.
This is the URL to your website. If entered, it'll appear on the board above the header by default.
The URL to your "uploads" folder.
This is a path, not a URL.

This can be left blank
This is useful for specifing a PATH for the IPB written files (skin_cache, style_avatars, style_emoticons, style_images) when dealing with load balanced/clustered servers. If you enter a PATH, please ensure that it ends with a trailing slash

This can be left blank
This can be used if you wish to serve images from a different server or when using clustered servers. Please ensure that you use a trailing slash and that it starts with http(s):// if entering a URL
Some NT installations will require this to be turned to 'no'.
This is for quick no-page redirects. Choose the option best suited to your server's OS.
setting.conf_extra: location=Location type (*nix savvy) refresh=Refresh (Windows savvy) html=HTML META redirect (If all else fails...)

setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this will remove any "Thanks...." redirection pages used to provide feedback to the user on their last action and will simply redirect without showing this page.
This controls the debug information shown at the footer of your board.
setting.conf_extra: 0=0: None - Don't show any debug information 1=1: Show server load, page generation times and query count 2=2: Show level 1 (above) and GET and POST information 3=3: Show level 1 + 2 and database queries

setting.conf_description: GZIP enables faster page transfers and lower bandwidth use however some servers are not configured to allow it.
If set to 'yes', add &debug=1 to any page to view the SQL information.
This setting is automatically set during installation but you can override the setting here if you wish. Safe mode skins doesn't cache to PHP files and uses the database exclusively.

You may choose which character to separate thousands from hundreds
(EG: USA & UK use a comma)
GD is an embedded graphics library in PHP. Most recent PHP installations come with GD2 which offers improved image functions. If you get errors by setting this to "GD2", then simply choose "GD1".
Removing this number will remove all links / chat functionality within IPB.
This is the type of chat service you purchased
This is the room that your chat users will be logged into first

If enabled, this will show who's chatting in the chat room on your forums home page underneath the active users list.

setting.conf_title: Hide Who's Chatting when no members are logged into chat?
Update local list no less than every:
setting.conf_description: The local list is updated from the master chat server by the frequency you set and cached locally. In minutes.
This is the default language used for the chat user inteface (buttons and labels, etc)
setting.conf_extra: english.conf=English spanish.conf=Spanish portuguese.conf=Portuguese italian.conf=Italian french.conf=French german.conf=German

setting.conf_description: "Plain mode" removes the colored chat text from your Invision Power Chat Advanced room(s), and implements single-colored (non-GUI) chat text. This will disable the graphic emoticons and click-able URLs.

setting.conf_extra: self=Normal IPB Page new=New Pop Up Window

setting.conf_title: Chat Room Pop-up Window Padding? (in px)
setting.conf_description: Allows window to open without scrollbars
To change your chat applet background color select any RGB value.
To change your chat applet foreground color select any RGB value.
To change your chat window background color select any RGB value.
To change your chat window foreground color select any RGB value.
To customize your font size replace "10" to whatever numeric value you wish.

setting.conf_description: You may select more than one

Your copyright removal key obtained from IPS.

This will appear inbetween the <title> elements on the page

setting.conf_title: Number of Articles to display in the main section

setting.conf_description: This will show a list of recent topic titles on the IPB Portal page

setting.conf_title: Max. no recent articles to show
Max. no recent discussions to show

setting.conf_description: Leave blank to not show a poll or the poll box

One per line in this format

setting.conf_title: Show Affiliates / Favoured Sites box content
setting.conf_description: Raw HTML enabled

This is the IPB registraton key NOT your customer code or client center password. To get your key, log into your client center and click on 'Invision Power Board' under 'Purchased Services'.
DO NOT REMOVE OR EDIT THIS KEY UNLESS YOU'RE SURE OF WHAT YOU'RE DOING!
If enabled, you can optionally add a "registered to" line at the bottom of your board.
Examples: Matthew Mecham, IPS, Inc.

setting.conf_title: Export news topics from which forum?
Show a 'Latest News' link on the board index?

setting.conf_description: BBCode is the [tag][/tag] format used to format text and apply other effects.
If set to "yes", your members will be allowed to use HTML in their personal messages. We recommend that you disbale this for security reasons.

setting.conf_title: Max. number of messages to show per page when viewing message list
setting.conf_description: The default is 50.

setting.conf_title: Enable the search engine spider recognition?
setting.conf_description: If set to "no", this feature will not be activated and all the settings below will have no effect.
If you're under heavy attack, switch this off as it may put a little extra load on the SQL server as it attempts to insert new data rows.

setting.conf_title: Treat spider/bot as part of which group?
setting.conf_description: This is useful as you can specify group settings for a 'bot' group which can restrict access to certain areas, etc.
This is useful as you can create a 'lite' optimized skin for your spiders to use to reduce bandwidth and increase the depth of the bot crawling.

setting.conf_title: Show spider/bot in the active users list?

setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", this makes all spider bots anonymous and they can only be seen by administrators.

Use this section to list which search engine user-agents you'd like to be treated as a search engine visit along with a 'human' name for the online list in a bot=Human Name format.(one per line)
Example: googlebot=Google.com
setting.conf_default: googlebot=Google.com slurp@inktomi=Hot Bot ask jeeves=Ask Jeeves lycos=Lycos.com whatuseek=What You Seek ia_archiver=Archive.org

setting.conf_description: Forces users to input a random code when registering and changing email address, etc to prevent bot's from spamming the forms.
setting.conf_extra: 0=None gd=Advanced (Requires GD library) gif=Normal (No special requirements)

setting.conf_description: If 'yes' users can post scripted image generators that are PHP/CGI scripts designed to 'look' like an image. This is used for random signature images, etc but can allow users to write malicious scripts which can interfere with the board.

If enabled, this will check the X_FORWARDED_FOR headers to match the user's IP address. This is useful in a intranet situation if the REMOTE_ADDR will be the same across the network. It will also help maintain AOL sessions but can be abused to forge incorrect headers to report an incorrect IP address. If unsure, leave off.
Removes inactive sessions over the limit you specify. The lower the number the less chance of a session being hijacked.
This further reduces the risk of session hijacking and tampering but it does mean that a user will have their session terminated if they use another browser at the same time.

setting.conf_title: Use secure mail form for member to member mails?
setting.conf_description: Hides the email address from other users and prevents email harvesting bots from gathering your members email addresses.
Advanced programmers can force images to run as scripts. IBF limits damage by this method however. This should only be disabled as an extreme measure.

setting.conf_title: Allow flash movies in posts and avatars?
setting.conf_description: Flash has a built in scripting language which may or may not compromise security. As flash gets more advanced the chances of it compromising your board increases. We recommend you leave this feature set to "no" unless you trust your community.
Make an administrator manually preview all new accounts or make new users validate their email address.

setting.conf_title: Remove incomplete registration validations after [x] days
setting.conf_description: This will automatically remove all unvalidated members after the number of days you specify. Enter "0" to not automatically remove unvalidated members.

setting.conf_title: Get notified when a new user registers via email?
setting.conf_description: This will send an email to the root administrator when a new user successfully registers on the board.

setting.conf_title: Force guests to log in before allowing access to the board?
setting.conf_description: If set to yes, any guest must either log in or register before they can view the board.
If set to "yes", this will not allow any guests to register an account on your board.
Can be used as a 'hidden' space to emulate registered names - but can cause problems in non Western character sets.

setting.conf_title: Disable 'Report this post to a moderator' link?
setting.conf_description: Removes the ability for your members to report a post.
Where do you want reported post notifications to go?

Make users wait before posting again
Can be left blank for no flood control and does not apply to members which belong to a group that can bypass flood control.

setting.conf_title: Allow users to browse the Active Users list?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", members and guests where allowed will be able to determine the whereabouts of each other on the online list. Topics and forums that the viewer doesn't have permission to see are not shown.

setting.conf_title: Disable root admin group viewing anonymous online users?
setting.conf_description: Anonymous users have an asterisk after their name

setting.conf_title: Disable root admin group viewing online users IP address in online user list?

setting.conf_description: If enabled, the subscription packages will be shown in the registration page and the registering member will be able to select one.

setting.conf_title: Force every member to require a subscriptions package
setting.conf_description: If enabled, the member must choose a package upon registration to proceed past the validating group and current members must purchase a subscription to view the board.

setting.conf_title: Member group to use after registration but before package purchase?
setting.conf_description: If you require that every member purchases a subscription, choose a group to move the member into once they have validated their registration prior to purchasing a subscriptions manager package. Members in this group will see the 'Purchase Subscriptions' page when logged in and if they don't already have a package.

setting.conf_title: Number of topics per forum page
Remove excess exclamation/question marks in topic titles?
setting.conf_description: Will turn: This!!!!! into This!
Will turn: CLICK HERE into Click Here

setting.conf_title: Number of posts needed to make a 'hot topic'?
Number of posts per topic page
Outline View: Number of posts per page
setting.conf_description: This controls how many posts are shown in the threaded tree per page. This helps to reduce server overhead on very large topics.
Selects the default topic view mode from 'Outline', 'Standard' and 'Linear Plus'.

setting.conf_title: Order posts within a topic by
Order posts within a topic by
Max. width of posted Flash movies (in pixels)
setting.conf_description: When using the [flash] tags where allowed

setting.conf_title: Max. height of posted Flash movies (in pixels)
setting.conf_description: When using the [flash] tags where allowed

setting.conf_title: No. characters to word wrap on?
setting.conf_description: Prevents long unbroken words which distort tables. 80 - 100 is recommended

setting.conf_title: No. emoticons per clickable table row
setting.conf_description: The clickable emoticons box is shown in the full posting form page.

This will remove any quoted text when quoting a post that contains quotes
..

Defines which images are allowed in [img][/img] tags.
Seperate with comma (gif,jpeg,jpg)

setting.conf_title: Show uploaded images in post as images?
setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", any image attachments in a post will be shown as the image and not as a downloadable link. Set this to yes to allow members to position their image attachments in the post using the [attachmentid] tag.
If the above option is set to "yes" to allow image attachments to show as the image select this option to show the attached image as a thumbnail which takes up less space and can be quicker to load.
If both options above are set to "yes", you can define the maximum width of the thumbnail. If attached images are smaller than the dimensions set here, they will not be shown as a thumbnail.
If both options above are set to "yes", you can define the maximum width of the thumbnail. If attached images are smaller than the dimensions set here, they will not be shown as a thumbnail.
This is for when a guest posts with a members name, it allows for a visual difference to prevent confusion
This is for when a guest posts with a members name, it allows for a visual difference to prevent confusion

setting.conf_description: If set to "yes", the poll creator will have the option of voting in their own poll.

setting.conf_title: Number of hours to keep open the ability for topic starters to attach a poll to their topic
setting.conf_description: Does not affect administrators or super moderators

setting.conf_title: DISABLE the ability for members to post a 'no-reply' poll?

setting.conf_description: If set to "no", this feature will not activated and the settings below will be ignored.

setting.conf_title: Designate which forum to use as the trash can?

Please choose which user groups you'd like to automatically be subscribed for email notification of new topics (not replies) in every forum available to them. This means that members having a selected PRIMARY group will be emailed everytime there is a new topic and they are not online to view it.
Note This will only send the email to those who have chosen to 'Allow emails from the administrators'.

setting.conf_description: If set to "no", the warn system will not be used and all warn levels will be hidden from view.

Minus numbers allowed. If using minus numbers, we recommend that you do not use the graphical blocks and percentage but use the 'rating' mode as 'warn mode' will not take into account a minus start number.
Members always start with a zero warn level when registered.

Groups that cannot be warned
You may choose more than one.

setting.conf_title: Allow all other non-protected groups to see their own warn level and reasons?
setting.conf_description: If set you "yes", members will be able to see their own warn level and reasons for their warns.

setting.conf_title: Allow warnings to continue once the minimum or maximum has been reached?

setting.conf_description: Controls which type of warn level meter is displayed.
setting.conf_extra: 0=Warn mode: Show graphical blocks & percentage 1=Rating mode: Show < min | current | max > level
